Looking at the View Comparison Window

Two different views can be compared and merged with the View Comparison utility by selecting View > Compare/Merge. This action displays the View Comparison window.

 

 

The upper left pane displays the folder hierarchy in the source view. The source view is the view from which you launched the View Comparison utility. If you wish, you can change to a different view by selecting the source pane and clicking View > Select View.

The upper right pane displays the folder hierarchy in the target view. You selected this view after selecting the source pane and clicking View > Compare/Merge. If you wish, you can change to a different view by selecting the target pane and clicking View > Select View.

Folders that exist in both views are listed on the same line as their equivalent folders. Folders that appear in only one view appear on a line of their own.

The item pane, at the bottom of the screen, contains a series of component tabs. By clicking these tabs, you can see the items of that type in the folders selected above, along with their revision numbers. If you have Enterprise Advantage, you will see tabs for folders, files, change requests, requirements, tasks, and topics. With other versions of the program, you will not see all of these components.

On the item pane, folders that appear in both views and items that exist in both folders are shown on the same line as their equivalent items.

If an item exists in only one folder, it is listed on that side of the pane. The icon indicates whether the item is included only in the target folder or only in the source folder.

If an item exists in both folders and you are tracking merges, you will see one of several different icons. They indicate whether:

  • The item has changed in the source view since the last recorded merge.

  • The item has changed in the target view since the last recorded merge.  

  • The item has branched and needs to be merged.

  • Two items are identical.

Refreshing the View Comparison Window

To ensure that the latest data displays in the View Comparison window, you can refresh the entire window or individual panes of that window. Activating any pane (for example, by selecting an item from it) always refreshes the pane.

To refresh the item pane:

From the Item or context menu, either select Refresh or click the Refresh item list button on the toolbar.

To refresh the source or target pane:

From the View or context menu, select Refresh. Updating the source or target pane often updates the item pane as well.

To refresh all the panes:

Select Window > Refresh from the menu.
